Internet is available, but weâ€™ve still not found a hotel that gets is â€“ yet â€“ without many phone calls and a lot of extra conversation. Since you have to get up and walk, often â€“ itâ€™s nice to have a lovely historic â€œpatioâ€� to escape to. Comfy outdoor couches for the consistent SD temperatures make the uncomfortable meeting room chairs bearable! A quick walk â€“ just a block - to Spaghetti Factory, The Oceanaire and Nobu and the 5th Avenue corridor makes up for the steep rack rate (barely). One more thing; if you are not a train/trolley fan, donâ€™t stay here. The train announces its arrival day and night and you can hear the train whistle through the hotel. There is a card in the room explaining why; but thereâ€™s no preparing for that first 4AM whistle!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel1125
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend in San Diego. The hotel is conveniently located in downtown. It is within walking distance of most places, Balboa mall, Gas lamp quarter, Little Italy, and Seaport Village. If a person doesn't want to walk, the hotel is across the street from the trolley. The service we received from the time we checked in until the time we checked out was excellent!!! We stayed on the 7th floor in a corner room, with one side facing the ocean side. The room was spacious, nicely decorated and very clean. However, at times a person can hear the trolley. The gym is perfect for a hotel gym. It has weight and cardio machines, each with its own headset and tv. The pool area is nice, with comfy chairs and a jacuzzi. We ate breakfast in the restaurant, it cost $14 per person for the buffet, which had a lot to chose from. What I liked the least was the valet parking only because it was $35 a day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotwire Price, Great Service, many 'little' charges added up.”
Reviews.Author: jenmattconlon
Reviews.Content: We lucked out and got a $49.00 room on Labor Day weekend in the heart of downtown San Diego's Gaslamp. We live in the area, but decided it would be fun to have a 'stayvacation' and show the kids some of the sites. Had a beautiful room, they checked us in 3 hours early. Location was awesome, in the heart of the gaslamp. They honored our request to stay on the 'quiet' side - away from the noise of the trolley tracks. The breakfast buffet was delicious, fully stocked, and well serviced. Within steps of the Convention Center, Petco Park, and the Old Spaghetti Factory. The few downsides - $28.00 a night parking, very small (yet classy) pool area, and pricey breakfast - cost almost $60.00 for three meals. (Though children 3 and under eat free.) Great trip overall!

Reviews.Title: “Nice upscale hotel but expensive”
Reviews.Author: EwokGirl
Reviews.Content: Visited on Father's Day weekend with spouse and children (10 & 12 yrs). The location was convenient but noisy with the train passing through. The rooms were smaller than I expected but overall the hotel was well maintained. The mandatory valet parking was expensive. For the price I paid at Hotwire - I would visit again but not if I had to pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located, got a great deal on Hotwire.”
Reviews.Author: Mueller98
Reviews.Content: We spent my 30th birthday in San Diego, and I did countless hours of research trying to decide on the best hotel. We finally went with the Hilton Gas Lamp, because we got a great deal on Hotwire. This is a basic hotel, its nice, very convenient location. We didn't have any train noise. We enjoyed the rooftop pool, it was nicely appointed. And the beds were incredibly comfy. I am seriously considering buy the bed from Hilton. It was fabulous! And one night we bought some wine at a CVS, and brought it back. But unfortunately left home without a corkscrew, and the bartender gave us one. It was really nice of him!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Labor Day weekend stay at the SD Hilton Gaslamp Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tempdragon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great Labor Day weekend stay at the San Diego Hilton Gaslamp Hotel. Because Iâ€™m a gold Hilton Honors member, I was upgraded to a top floor room on the 12th floor. Check in was a breeze and the staff was professional. Parking was valet only and at $35, kind of expensive, but that is comparable for the area. The valet however was convenient and efficient. The room was spacious and clean. It was nicely decorated. The beds were nice and the large LCD TV was a plus. From my side of the building, I had a great view of the HardRock Hotel pool and lounge area. The music was kind of loud, but it was turned off at night. I did not hear any trolley or train noises from my room. I however heard the aftermath of the partying from everyone walking from the elevators to their rooms. Ironically, I did not hear any noises from the rooms next door, however the noise from the hallway was loud and clear. (they should put some insulation tape underneath the doors to muffle the noise) The gym was functional and it worked out great for my wife. There are headsets at the treadmill for watching TV. The heated pool area was kind of small, but it was good for the kids. The Jacuzzi only seats 4, however the temperature was just right. It was great to come back after a day of sightseeing and going to the pool. For the gold Hilton Honor members, there are no executive floor lounges, however they do provide you with breakfast coupons to be used in the in-house restaurant. The service staff was great. They were friendly and efficient. It is a standard breakfast buffet with an omelet station. The food quality was good and fresh. Iâ€™m a starbucks drinker and the coffee wasnâ€™t bad. It was freshly brewed. The fresh squeezed orange juice was also very good. I think the normal price for the breakfast buffet is $12.95. Overall, Iâ€™m very happy with my stay at the Hilton. The location was perfect. It is within walking distance to most of downtown. The staff was courteous and professional. We will definite come back to this hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just don't park there!”
Reviews.Author: baloobear
Reviews.Content: Just to clarify the $35 mandatory parking fee is only mandatory if you choose to park at the hotel. There are plenty of parking lots nearby, or between 6pm and 8am, you can park outside the hotel for free at one of the meters! Its very safe as the valet is present 24/7/365!! The hotel is very modern in style, located just over from the the Convention Center and at the bottom of the Gaslamp area. The hotel is split into two parts - the main hotel or The Lofts, accessed by a private elevator. I was staying in The Lofts, amazing rooms, and upgraded to one with a whirlpool bath. Large oversized rooms await for you in The Lofts, very comfortable king bed, large lounge area, 42" plasma, games station, fridge for your goodies, coffee machine, and then separate bath and separate shower room with window into the lounge area. Staff really great and accomodating, very present and willing to help. Pool area is small, and can be noisy as it overlooks the tram and amtrak railway so you do get the clanging of the railway crossing bell and the sound of the trains horn. This is the only downside I can think of. Handy for all of the tourist attractions, close to all of the restaurants in Gaslamp and the Horton Plaza Shopping Center. Ralph's supermarket just around the corner with loads of goodies and fantastic food to go. Great for families and business alike - a really good hilton!

Reviews.Title: “$35 MANDATORY Parking Fee, Are you kidding me?”
Reviews.Author: Nate L
Reviews.Content: Wow, AFTER booking the hotel room on "your guess is as good as mine" Priceline, we found out that the hotel charges a whopping $35 PER DAY for parking. The only parking here is valet so they think they can get away with that. I understand how valet parking works, but to have it as the only option is wrong. Shame on Hilton for only having mandatory $35 + Tip valet parking, and shame on Priceline for not disclosing that or including it in the price and then saying "Sorry man, you've already booked". I'm filing a report with the BBB. It's true what people say about the loud trains, rude staff, and un-caring help. Really, save yourself the headache.

Reviews.Title: “Great Priceline Win!!”
Reviews.Author: bg217
Reviews.Content: Got this for about $75 on Priceline and we were quite pleased with the win. The room was great -- on the tenth floor with nice views of the city. Were treated to some fireworks a bit after we checked in! Bed was super comfortable, free internet hook-up, room was spotless. Only complaint was that we wanted to take a swim but it was filled with splashing kids when we tried, so it wasn't really going to happen. But that wasn't a fault of the hotel, of course. We parked at a garage off K and it was a breeze for about $16. It's in a nice walkable part of San Diego, although we arrived on a Friday night and some streets were PACKED with people gussied up for a night on the town. If I knew anything about the Gaslamp I would have expected it, but I'd never been to the area. Oh and there's a great convenience store across the street, but note that it stops selling alcohol at 11PM on the weekends because of all the partying in the area. So if you want to take something back to your room, get it early :)

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Hilton's in USA - HH Diamond Member”
Reviews.Author: sdvander
Reviews.Content: Concierge MIKE was EXCELLENT. Booked a sail on America's Cup boat and I had a blast. Hotel was clean and staff was very welcoming. Room was great and location couldn't be better. Thanks for a great stay in San Diego. Breakfast waited great as well. All around great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Romantic!!”
Reviews.Author: personaltouchgifts
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at the Hilton in the Gaslamp Quarter. My husband had a business meeting scheduled in San Diego and I tagged along. My husband booked this hotel because of the location in the center of the Gaslamp Quarter. The moment we drove up and were greeted by the friendly valet, I knew this was a hotel that was going to be great. My husband is a Diamond member for Hilton so the front desk staff upgraded us to a suite. The room was absolutely beautiful! Talk about location, location, location! While my husband went off to work, I strolled up and down the Gaslamp area. At night we simply walked to a string of fabulous restaurants. I can't say enough about what a great weekend we experienced at this hotel. Loved it and now can't wait for my husband to schedule another meeting in San Diego!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, feels like a boutique property, AND its in stumbling distance to Gaslamp"”
Reviews.Author: DaMayorBoston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 1 night, 8/8, after deciding to extend our San Diego getaway an extra day, I pricelined this hotel for $80 bucks, so it could have been a fleabag and i still would have been happy. Its right in the gaslamp quarter, 1 block from the Hard Rock Hotel, and all the restaurants and bars. I wish we had stayed here the whole night. The rooms are smallish and the bathroom doesnt have a fan which keeps it damp after a shower, but overall very cool. Flat Screen tv's, nice linens, the whole 9 yards. Service seemed a little uninterested but nothing to get upset about. Valet is $35, but there is a parking garage 2 blocks away for $8/day, drop your bags off and walk back to the hotel. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rust Rust and Dust”
Reviews.Author: linsanjose
Reviews.Content: Bathroom condition was poor. Rusty bathtub and accessories. Shower head ring was loose. Air filter was extremely dusty.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, but not cheap.”
Reviews.Author: SeattleWizzard
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days during ComicCon. Close to all the action, close to many good restaurants and bars. Very helpful staff, but if you want a room refrigerator ask early and multiple times. No microwaves or refrigerators in rooms, at least the one we were in. It took two days to get refrigerator set up. The soda/water machine near room had warm drinks so ice and refrigerator were needed. Room service expensive, but food was very good and promptly delivered. With so many places to eat nearby I was surprised at the cost of the room service, I would think it would have been less expensive than it was. Overall very good place to stay, especially for ComicCon. Entry doors to convention center just 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “not a good place if youre traveling for business”
Reviews.Author: playwithtoy
Reviews.Content: if youre coming for business i wouldnt recommend staying here yes - its nice and a comfortable and modern but the internet access is TERRIBLE a good portion of my business is conducted over the internet first off theres no wireless in any of the rooms you can connect via hardwire but you better bring your own cable if you have more than one computer and even if you do connect via hardwire the connection is about the speed of dialup which means that even sending out one email you might get timed out i thought i might get a reprieve when they said i could connect wireless in the lobby but even there the router speed is 11mbps which still only allows me to send out the simplest of emails and not get any true work or even googling research done if you dont need to use a computer then this place is fine but i find it truly ironic that i have to come to the marriot lobby to use their wireless to even write this review!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: BrenTheLibran
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Gaslamp is in the perfect location. It is next to the SD Convention center which overlooks the Bay, and there is a trolley stop. There are countless restaurants and shops and lively happy people lining the Gaslamp area. The room itself was neat, clean, sleek, and had a nice flat screen TV. My only suggestion to update the room is the shower head. It is old school but functional. I only spent 1 day in SD, but we will definitely be back, and probably at this hotel. The room usually goes for 200/night but I lucked out and got the room for 86 on priceline. Be aware, you will pay for parking, about $10 / 12hr.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MattSF76
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Gaslamp is in a perfect location. Next to the trolly line, the convention center, Petco Park and the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter. The rooms are nice size, and in good condition. We had a king bed in the Loft building. Loved the huge flat screen TV. The pool is a little on the small side and nothing fancy. (not recommended if you wanted a place for the kids to spend hours in the pool.) Got a great rate of $106 a night on Hotwire. Nice that the hotel is medium sized as many of the downtown hotels are huge. The service was good as well, but didn't have much interaction with the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and Comfortable Suite”
Reviews.Author: lbedrington
Reviews.Content: Booked a 1 bedroom suite located on a corner in the older section. Got great through Triple A. Loved having lots of windows that opened. It was spacious, comfortable, quiet & clean. We always travel with a fan in case the room is hot or noisy but we used it for the white noise. Toilet and tub are in a room. Hilton Gaslamp website says the bathroom has a separate shower, it does not. But it does have a jetted tub. Separate dressing area has large granite vanity. Living area & bedroom both have large, flat screen TVs. Had a problem with a/c but was fixed immediately. Get a Styrofoam ice chest at Mini mart across street. They have cold drinks, wine, liquor, etc. and Ralph's supermarket is within walking distance. Worth it if you are staying for 3 or 4 days.

Reviews.Title: “Severe plumbing problems - Room smelled like sewage”
Reviews.Author: GiggityGiggityGoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel had some positive aspects, but all were far outweighed by a serious problem I encountered during my stay here. My room smelled like raw sewage, clearly due to a serious plumbing problem. (My tub drain gurgled and emitted the odor when a neighboring room flushed the toilet) The smell was intermittent, but strong when it was there. Worse than that, the hotel staff didn't even blink when I complained about it - they sent someone who poured air freshener down the drain and left!! When I complained again and suggested that this was not acceptable and abnormal for a hotel room, a hotel desk rep said "I don't know, I'm not a plumber." I'm simply incredulous at the lack of concern over such an unhealthy situation. The room number was 733 - if you do decide to book this hotel, make sure you do not get that room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bretmd
Reviews.Content: Booked via Hotwire and received a fabulous rate. Front desk was very accommodating to my requests a check in, despite the hotel being full, and the hotwire rate. The room was oversized compared to a typical guest room, the bed was wonderful, and the housekeeping staff was superb. The location is great. Parking was not a problem - parked in the lot on 6th and K and spent $8 per night, although this would have been much higher if I kept my car parked there during the day. The only downside was the noise from the train - however a room on the other side of the hotel would solve the problem. Definitely the best SD hotel I've stayed at - will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Even though we only stayed for one night, it was great!”
Reviews.Author: conradbaines
Reviews.Content: During a baseball road trip in August, we stayed here on August 29 while we were in town to see the Padres play. It was the perfect location and was walking distance from Petco Park!!!! And there was free breakfast!!! It was a great stay and I am definitely going back!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible customer service!”
Reviews.Author: dawnso
Reviews.Content: We had requested a loft suite with balcony, but were told that room was not available due to other guests staying on!! Reception stated that we didn't specifically request balcony, even though my confirmation stated otherwise. We were dissapointed as we had spent a lot of time choosing hotel/room, as trip was our honeymoon. The room we were given was king loft suite, which had lovely big windows and was large & clean. There is small pool area, which was quiet but great to chill out after day sightseeing. Downside I would say was there was no mini bar in the room, instead having to use room service. Would probably say that hotel is more for business travellers due to be close to convention centre, though it is at start of Gaslamp. If I was to visit San Diego again I would stay at Hard Rock Hotel or on Coronardo Island.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Comfort”
Reviews.Author: joni960
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Gaslamp is a stylish hotel in a great location -- right in the Gaslamp District on a jogging trail next to a small park-like area. The rooms are clean, fresh and tastefully appointed. Although I had to walk further to get to my meeting in the business district, I appreciated not hearing the noise from the airport (the hotels in the business district are closer to the airport and can have noise issues). The side of the Hilton facing the convention center borders the train tracks, which can be annoying if one of the freight trains comes trough early in the morning, so you may want to ask for a room on the other side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Bostontravels
Reviews.Content: We used Hilton honors points to book this hotel so the price was right. It was just fine in a business resort sort of way. The beds were comfortable, there was a small pool and hot tub area that my kids enjoyed very much and it was conveniently located to good restaurants, San Diego Zoo, SeaWorld, etc. Per some previous reviews, I agree the hotel valet charge of $32 per day is way too high. We used it b/c we had tired kids and luggage, but if we'd been traveling adults only, we would have parked a block away and walked. As for noise, I wasn't bothered at all. I asked my husband his opinion and he mentioned that he heard the noise in a background sort of way. We both lived on a busy street in the city for years so I think we just automatically block out any noises. We were not facing the trolley side, but we were 90 degrees to it, just a room or two off that side. The pool area is open and directly faces the trollies and I didn't even find the noise bothersome there so I guess it's all what you're used to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel right in the middle of all the action”
Reviews.Author: mrkinchas
Reviews.Content: Hilton Gaslamp is probably the best hotel in San Diego in regards to locale and ambiance. Right away upon check-in I was notified that I was upgraded to a loft suite (Hilton Diamond by the way). The room was exquisite. Very trendy and modern look and feel to it. I could definitely get used to these rooms :) Right outside the hotel and you are in the Gaslamp Quarter where you can eat, drink, and enjoy yourself San Diego style. Make sure you check out Rei Do Gado for you Brazilian Steakhouse fanatics. Staff was great and accommodating with a late checkout for a late flight.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of fun in downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: HCS
Reviews.Content: Cleanliness: overall, pretty good. coffee cups were either used or coffee machine had leaked excess coffee into the mugs (which were underneath the spout of the coffeemaker per machine design). Also, the bathroom had a few suspect hairs near the sink. But, overall, perfectly clean. Bedding was very fresh and clean. Location: great spot! right at the edge of the gaslamp and marina districts, steps from petco park and the convention center. restaurants in the area are all really pricey, so be prepared to shell out $50 for a decent dinner for two. a good bet is the tin fish, if you like an outdoor, backyard party type atmosphere. steps from the trolley, a few blocks from the Horton plaza shopping center. lots of bars in the area if you like to go out drinking. rooms: very comfortable king sized bed. bathroom was rather small compared to the room's overall size, but it was just fine... a good, basic, bathroom. our room faced the street so it was a bit noisy just before and after the Padres games, but it wasn't bad at all. if you are a light sleeper, a basic pair of earplugs would take care of any street noise. i suppose you could here the baseball games or the train/trolley coming and going if your room was on the backside of the hotel, but again, the earplugs would do the trick. great people watching from street-side rooms. service: no complaints. upon arrival, when i discovered the dirty coffee cups, i called housekeeping and two clean ones were brought right up. though the mandatory valet parking was a bummer, the valet staff were helpful and friendly. they went to our car and fished out our jackets for us in a jiffy. value: we booked on priceline and got the room for about $100 a night, so i'd say it was a pretty good value. no free breakfast or anything, and the valet parking price was horrible ($32 a night, with no self park options), but virtually all the hotels in that area charge about $30 a night for valet parking, and there are no self-park lots we could find that would let you leave your car overnight. other: fitness room was quite pleasant and well-equipped. pool was small but nice, and the deck chairs around the pool were lovely and very pleasant for watching the train/people come and go. very pleasant paved walking path right behind the hotel that goes for a few miles, i think. great jogging/strolling! also, the lobby of the hotel and outside patios/courtyards were very pretty and soothing. spa on site as well as a nice looking restaurant... didn't eat there, but the smells coming from it seemed pretty good! the hotel did have a business center, but you had to pay for internet access, which seemed like a crime to me at such a nice place. i would recommend this hotel for a nice weekend getaway in the gaslamp. oh, and easy freeway access, too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and staff, but valet parking is mandatory”
Reviews.Author: Snakepudding
Reviews.Content: My wife set this up using Priceline. The problem was that we didnâ€™t know the hotel, and therefore the rules, until we had committed full room payment. We then discovered a valet only parking with a fee of $32 per day. A few months ago we were at the Hilton San Diego Bayfront and they had self parking for $20. We had the choice of parking a number of blocks away and paying for every re-entry, so there wasnâ€™t an acceptable option. Because of this issue I say minus points to both the hotel and Priceline. Enough said about this issue. Overall, the experience was good when excluding the parking requirement. The internet connection was free contrary to published reviews. It was a little slow and a Hilton page kept popping up when attempting to go to Google.com. The front desk staff & valet staffs were very nice and helpful. It was easy drives to the locations we wanted to visit. This Hilton was better located to explore the Gaslight District, so walking was not a problem. This was in contrast to the Hilton Bayfront, newer, that required traversing through the Convention Center at night with what seemed to be questionable people hanging out. The room was nice. It had a good flat panel TV but running in analogue. One TV movie costs $14 rental and could have been found for 99c at the Redbox rental. The view was very nice and I plan to post photos taken from our windows. The Commuter Trains ran directly outside and presented little more noise that the SF Cable Cars. The worst noise came when a Truck was blocking the tracks and one of the Red Cars repeatedly released the attack of his horn for what seemed to be a very long time. The bathroom was small, one sink, and not much light. It was a one person at a time room. The bath/shower was a little slippery and there was no rubber bath tub matt to be found. The bottom line is that we would be willing to stay there again if it were not for the mandatory valet parking. We will likely look elsewhere for our next trip to this area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - glad we decided to NOT stay at the new Bayfront!”
Reviews.Author: tber
Reviews.Content: I was in san Deigo this past week tagging along on my husbands convention. The convention and original reservations we had were for the new Hilton Bayfront. A month or so ago, after reading reviews of the Bayfront, I suggested we move to the Hilton Gas lamp. With the corporate rate from Bayfront, we could even 'upgrade' to the Lofts on 5th and still be saving money. The location seemed better for dinneres at night and overall, just more positive. SO HAPPY WE MOVED! My husband checked in day before me and we were upgraded from a Loft balcony room to a whirlpool room. These are almost 800 feet of luxury...two large windows that overlooked the top of the Gaslamp and the 'hopping' Hard Rock across the street. Comfy bed, lovely linens, flatscreen tv. The shower was wonderful and I actually did get to enjoy the whirlpool tub after a long trip from the east coast! The location could not be better. We could easily walk to tons of resturants, the mass transit system, convention center and various tour company pickups. The walk to the Bayfront was not far but so happy after a night of eating and drinking, we did not have to make that walk. Friends staying there said the rooms were clean but SMALL and the location is a bit off the beaten path. We experienced no problems...saw people enjoying the lovely pool.. and had a fantastic stay! Will absolutely recommend this hotel for the location primarily but the Lofts are a special treat! *I will address the train noise that I read about...yes, there are train tracks and yes, you can hear the train..but you can hear the train just about anywhere within a 1 mile radius of whereever it is! it is LOUD..Even when walking near the Marriott Marina hotel area, it was loud. I heard it once the first afternoon and once one evening later and other than that - was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “3:30am train”
Reviews.Author: willis08
Reviews.Content: Great hotel except the 3:30am train that blows the horns ridiculously loud. i know the area can't be that packed with people at that time of day. there is no reason for that many horn blows. I got upgraded to one of the loft suites and it is one of the best rooms i've ever been in. i did stay for the entire month of January 2009. $7k hotel bill. $32/day parking seems a bit high. if you don't tip the bell boys, you don't get your items you ordered online and/or laundry, you have to go to the front desk to get them even after they say they will get someone to bring it up to you.The food was above average. location is good if you aren't going to stay extended periods, that train affected my sleep which affected my work. I will not stay at this hotel again for business longer than a couple days because of the train. The hotel is in a fantastic location for the GasLamp Quarter. it's with in close walking distance of everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break Trip”
Reviews.Author: VacationsAreGood4You
Reviews.Content: The night before our trip to San Diego we did not know where we were going to stay. One of the reviews we read on Trip Advisor said they got a great deal on Priceline. We had never used Priceline and decided to give it a shot. We bid $75 and got the Hilton. We couldn't believe the value as many of the 4-star hotels in the Gaslamp were $200 plus! The hotel has a beautiful lobby, great rooms with views and an excellent location near many restaurants and shops. The only negative is the $32 daily valet parking fee. There is no option to self-park. The good news is there is a parking garage only one and a half blocks away for $20 per day. While in San Diego make sure you take a tour of the USS Midway aircraft carrier. We also went to the Wild Animal Park and spent a day on Coronado Beach in front of the Hotel Del Coronado.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the middle of everything with a fantastic pool!”
Reviews.Author: American-Hungarian
Reviews.Content: My husband had to go to San Diego for work and I tagged along. The hotel was above average in the foyer. However, our room was nice with feather pillows and a down comforter. I had read the reviews prior to our trip, so I called ahead to make sure we had a room on the "quiet side" of the hotel. I urge anyone looking to sleep to do the same. The staff was very hospitable. Our room included a large flat panel TV and free internet. The bathrooms have automatic timed lights. This was a very convenient feature was we got used to it. I was able to thoroughly enjoy the beautiful pool and lounge chairs! I was pleasantly surprised to find the pool was a saltwater pool, very nice! They have a pretty decent workout room with some free weights, a fit ball and machines (everything was pretty new). I never ate at the restaurant within the hotel but my husband did and wasn't too thrilled with it. Also, given the area there are so many great restaurants within walking distance. For breakfast I can definitely recommend The Cheese Shop! They have a full breakfast menu all day, and it's less than a 5 minutes walk. On a bad note, the business center within the hotel was not working and none of the staff was able to help. So come prepared! One last thing, do not valet park at the hotel. You can park a block a way for $10-$15 a night and it's safe.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel..be aware of the $32.00 extra parking fee”
Reviews.Author: canadianvisitor09
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at this hotel and got a great rate via "HOTWIRE". The room and hotel were nice enough, but I was a little surprised when we pulled up and were advised the overnight parking rate was $32.00. Now maybe I'm not a big city gal but I felt violated at being charged that much for overnight parking. The curbside entrance to the hotel left us with little options but to pay. The next night we came back from the Zoo around dinner and spent .55minutes driving a six block radiace to find street parking. My persistance paid off and we did get a metor right in front of the hotel, although I was almost ready to pay the expensive parking about the time we found the parking spot. We never ate in the resturant or ordered a beverage after that I wasn't prepared to pay for anything on the property for fear of the unexpected prices. Stay, but not with a car.

Reviews.Title: “Smack bang in the Gas lamp Quarter”
Reviews.Author: KiwiR0b
Reviews.Content: We checked out a number of Hotels and this hotel and the Omni seemed to fit what we wanted . For a Hilton it was a very small intimate hotel with a number of great and not so great features. What we liked 1/ Great location , could not of been better 2/Comfortable rooms and beds 3/Small Hotel so no crowds in lobby etc 4/Helpful staff What we didnt like 1/ $33 to park a car ..very expensive 2/ The buffet breakfast was very average for the total cost involved ,small selection of basic foods. These guys need to go to Asia to see hows its done properly Other than that it was a pleasant stay in San Diego. I would say it was an good hotel for a 3 1/2 star and a average for a 4 star . We paid $200 plus taxes plus parking directly from the Hilton site and on reflection would of found somewhere with cheaper parking and not got the breakfast , still the location was superb and we parked the car and forgot about it .

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: MzRKO
Reviews.Content: This hotel has wonderful accomdations, the room and bathroom were adequate size and extremely clean. The food service through room service was excellent the breakfast service in the restuarant was horrid. I recommend eating at one of the restaurants near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great San Diego Trip”
Reviews.Author: Catori76
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a nice hotel although the lobby and restaurant has some wear and tear. I have read some reviews in which people complained about the train. I must say that when we checked in we were offered a choice between a room with a view and the noise from the train or room with less view and no noise from the train. So clearly the hotel does try to make accomodations for this inconvenience. The rooms were very nice and well appointed although the bathroom was a bit on the small side. Other than that no complaints. The bed was comfy and the furniture was in good shape. The lobby and restaurant however were another story. The restaurant has a unique configuration. It appears that the architect or designer tried to make it like living room furniture and that is just not comfortable for restaurant dining. Not to mention the poor service. The food was cold and when part of my mother's order did not arrive the server said " Oh I just put it on her plate." That meant my plate. Ummm...eww. So beyond that the food was cold, we tried to send it back but the server disappeared, we had to get someone else to help us, it was an ordeal, you get the idea. Not fun. The rest of the stay was pleasant and San Diego was awesome! The hotel staff was courteous and outside of the hiccup with the restaurant it was a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but some problems”
Reviews.Author: platinum1
Reviews.Content: My husband I stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp during a weekend in December. The hotel is located in the Gaslamp District. We couldn't figure out why it is called the Gaslamp District because there were no gaslamps to be found. The hotel is within walking distance to numerous restaurants, bars, the convention center, Petco Park, and Seaport Village. The hotel has a gym, pool and hot tub. However, when we tried to use the hot tub one night around 9:40pm it was closed. We called the front desk to inquire why it was closed and were told that it was closed each night "around 10pm." We were supposed to have been given an upgraded room as we are Hilton Honors diamond members but were told we could not be moved because we had pre-ordered wine to our room and it could not be moved. There seemed to be a lack of customer service at this hotel, but the accommodations were nice.

Reviews.Title: “More like a Motel 6 1/2 than a Hilton”
Reviews.Author: MauiDiver
Reviews.Content: I'm a Hilton Diamond Member so I usually try to only book Hiltons for business travel. First of all the other comments about trains and noise is correct, I was upgraded to the club floor which is right next to trail and trolley tracks. I could live with that but this property has some issues, all the refrigerators have been removed from the rooms, even the club floor rooms. During my one week stay they just out right refused to change my sheets even thought I called house keeping and the front desk on my first night and ask that this be done as I had a bad cold and was perspiring at night. Yes, I contacted the on duty Manager each time who sent the housekeeping staff up to change them after each complaint. Then the next neat trick was house keeping just rinsing out the glasses and coffee cups vs. putting out clean ones each day (nice since I had guest visiting and using the cups). When I checked in the glasses had fingerprints and lip marks on them. Also beware of the wake up call system at this hotel, I had two days when the wake up call did not occur, I called the front desk and was told that it showed I did not answer. One of the folks traveling with me figured out that their computer system says "you have a wake up call at 6 a.m. set" but you actually have to add one minute each day 6:01, 6:02 or you will NOT get a wake up call. I thought it was funny when I checked in and called for my first wake up call and it said "you currently have a wake up call set for 4:15 a.m.". Also brought the problem and the solution to the managerâ€™s attention who said "we have a lot of customer complaints about that". Gee, ya think folks staying on business have to be anywhere? The bathrooms are equipped with motion sensors so you cannot leave a light on at night, and if you have to get up in the middle of the night for the bathroom you will really enjoy the blinding lights when the motion detector see you coming. The room temp cannot be set at one temp aka I like my room at 70 degrees, you have to choose AC or heat then try to get the room to your temp manually during my week long stay I was either roasting or cold. I'm sure they are implementing this measure to save money, but it also will drive off your Diamond Customers. Since I'm a Diamond Member they give you a free breakfast each morning. The food was mess hall quality and the same morning after morning. The staff in restaurant were very nice and the service was good each morning. Beware of the $32.00 valet only parking at this hotel - the valet's were quick to get your car but for $32.00 would you expect anything less. TV in the club floor rooms are old 19" not flat screens. Then just to top off the week, I went down to drop off a Corporate FedEx box (pre-paid corporate account) and was handed a legal size form that they told me to fill out and they would charge me $10.00 for letting me leave the box for pickup -nice way to give that extra bit of service to your Diamond Members. My Co-worker also had billing problems when she went to check out; they were trying to overcharge her by $300.00 from her reservation price. The clerk on duty was just rude to her and would not make the corrections even after being shown the Hilton reservation confirmation. Only after getting the GM involved did they correct here charges. If you have to been in the Gas lamp areas near the convention center this property is walking distance, but I'd try another hotel. I'm starting to see Hilton fail the Diamond Members at most properties that I have stayed at since the chain was sold to "Blackstone Group". They seem to be really cutting corners on everything from not changing the sheets, to nickel and dime you for every little item or service. Anyone know how to trade your Hilton Diamond status to another chain?

Reviews.Title: “dog friendly - but the fees kill the deal”
Reviews.Author: edgycated
Reviews.Content: booked 2 nights at the hilton gaslamp for business/pleasure. did some research homework and it was the cheapest rate (hotwire - $104/night) i could find in gaslamp at a hotel that is dog friendly. the location is great and the rooms are clean and spacious. and there is a on-leash dog run right outside the hotel. however, a couple complaints. yes, they allow pets - but the cleaning fee is a hefty $75!! most hotels charge $50 at most. several of the hotels in gaslamp charge no fee!! secondly, they had no fridges. i requested one as soon as we checked in, but they were mysteriously short-handed and never ended up receiving one. thirdly, the valet parking fee of $32 seems to be in line with the other hotels in the area, but it is steep nonetheless. throw in another $10 for internet access. if i could rebook our trip, i would have rather stayed at the solamar. no dog fee, 50% off parking fee for hybrids, free internet, and free wine social everynight. the going rate that weekend was a little higher (~$190), but after all the fees the hilton charged, a stay at the solamar wouldve been cheaper. but that being said, san diego is a great city and very dog friendly. make sure to check out the oyster bar at the oceanaire down the street and take your pooch to the off-leash dog beach on coronado.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, parking not so much”
Reviews.Author: compton49er
Reviews.Content: Hotel and rooms were very nice. Staff was very friendly and always very helpful. Location was everything. Great for getting on the trolley system or for walking to many restaurants and shops in gaslamp. Close drive to Balboa Park as well. Only complaint is outrageous price for valet parking ($32 per night) with no other options available. However, valet staff is very quick, friendly, and helpful. Got a great rate from priceline, so takes the bite out of parking fee. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location outrageous parking fees”
Reviews.Author: Glove4me
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, but expensive parking rates, Only problem I had was booking a room with 2 beds and after checking in, only rooms with one bed were available, Hotel did provide a free roll a way bed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, But the Omni Spoiled Us”
Reviews.Author: KittyCat
Reviews.Content: We've been lucky enough to have snagged a great deal at the Omni San Diego for the past few years during the holidays, but unfortunately this year, the Omni didn't offer very good rates. So, I checked out the Hilton Gaslamp on-line and saw that it was in the same area so I thought we'd give it a try. First off, the location is great! It's within walking distance to everything, and our room overlooked the San Diego Convention Center and a dog park below. The hotel sits at the entrance to the Gaslamp district, but is very quiet. However, when we checked into our room on Christmas night, we did not have a comforter or blanket on our bed: just a sheet. There was no honor bar either. And, when we realized we forgot to pack a hairbrush, we found out that the hotel does not have a gift shop for essentials, so we were sent across the street to a mini-mart where we did not find a hairbrush. Parking 2 blocks away was less expensive than the $30 a night fee at the hotel, (we were charged $15 at the garage) but parking in the lot adjacent to the Omni was far cheaper. Overall, I'd say this was an okay hotel, but we still like the Omni better!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous week at this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MALUV2Travel
Reviews.Content: We stated at the Hilton during a convention and could not have made a better choice. The hotel is directly across the street from the convention center and you can walk everywhere you need to in the city. This is in the heart of the Gaslamp District, surrounded by excellent restaurants. It is 2 blocks from Petco Park. We stayed in the Loft Rooms; beautiful, spacious with outdoor terrace. It felt like staying in an apartment in the city. The pool is small but private and very clean. We were given a refrigerator at no charge; just ask for one. There is a small deli across the street that sells staples and the World Market is just around the corner which has great prices on beer, wine, water, tea, etc.. We would definitely come back to this Hilton!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: SMS1953
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Diego for 5 days and this hotel was absolutely wonderful! The service was great, the room was very clean and the housekeeping staff did a great job in straightening up our room every day. Everyone from the bell hop to the bartender were very helpful and made our stay VERY enjoyable. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: momof4inaz
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Hilton. This hotel had everything to keep us comfortable. Great beds, very helpful staff, great pool and good location. Our only complaint is very expensive parking. $32 a day.

Reviews.Title: “A steal on priceline.com”
Reviews.Author: veeRob
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel about a month ago when visiting San Diego for it's Street Scene music festival. My friend and I were able to book a Saturday night at the Hilton for $99 + tax via priceline.com, which was a steal compared to their normal rates. The hotel was right in the heart of the gaslamp district, walking distance from the convention center. Front desk staff was very helpful, and the beds were very comfortable. Valet parking is a high-priced $32/night, but I was able to find street parking for free as they stop enforcing the meters at 6pm and don't enforce on Sundays. At worst, there is a garage two blocks down at 6th & K that charges around $16/day, so try to use that if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: JohnSwansea_U_K_
Reviews.Content: The Hilton Gaslamp is as suggested in the Gaslamp quarter which holds many restaurants, bars and clubs so is very convenient for nightlife. The hotel itself is a fairly modern building in two parts which are interconnected, we were in one of their loft suites. These suites are a little overrated as they are quite small with just one room plus bathroom not what one expects from a suite which normally have at least one extra room as well as the bedrooom. Ours was also a little cramped. However everything worked and the staff were pleasant and helpful. There is small pool at one side of the main building, I cannot report further on this as I am not a "pool person" but it looked pleasant and uncrowded. Service in the bar was a little hit and miss, if you were sitting where the waitress could not see you it may take a while to get served! Breakfast was the usual American buffet affair with plenty of choice and the option of freshly cooked eggs in any style. Altogether a pleasant if unspectacular stay.

Reviews.Title: “All you can ask for and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTrips
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the Hilton Gaslamp district. We visited this place after our honeymoon and thought that it was reasonable and relatively cheap. I used Priceline and bid on 4 star hotels downtown and got this gem of a place. It's right next to Petco Park, within 1/2 block of the Gaslamp district, and driving distance from Coronado island and all the beaches. Rooms were modern and to be honest, it was one of the best hotel I've stayed with and I always stay at Marriott's, Hilton's, or Hyatt's when I travel for pleasure or work. Ultra clean and even though your near gaslamp area, you can sleep and not worry about being bothered. Great hotel if you can find the right deal ($$$).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: We took a quick weekend trip to San Diego and got the Hilton with a $94/night bid on priceline. Including tax and fees it came out to $113 a night, which was a great deal for the location and the quality of the room. There is only valet parking at the hotel and it's $32/night so we parked at a lot 2 blocks away on 4th and K Street and that came out to $17/night so basically there isn't a very cheap alternative when it comes to parking in the area. The location was great. There are a ton of restaurants and bars in the Gaslamp Quarter and a ton of nightlife so if that's what you're looking for it's only steps away from a ton of action. It's also only a few miles away from Sea World, Coronado Island, and the Zoo. If you're there for a baseball game it's also very convenient being only a couple blocks from Petco Park. The room itself is just what you'd expect from a Hilton. The hotel is very modern and it has a smaller more boutique hotel type of feel to it than a lot of other Hiltons, though. I think it was built in 2000 so the look and feel is sleek and new. My only complaints were that the tv was a smaller tube tv, the remote control didn't work, and noise from the hallway was seemingly amplified into the room. There are train tracks right next to the hotel that didn't cause us any noise issues and when we were outside the train passed and it was pretty quiet. The warning bells at the railroad crossing were a bit louder and might be heard if you're on that corner of the hotel. All in all, it was just what we've come to expect from a Hilton and we'd enjoy staying here again, especially at the Priceline rate.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but would not pay rack rate”
Reviews.Author: bananaDallas
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel by bidding with priceline. We got it for 60% off rack rate. Since I knew t hat downtown hotels are notorious for outrageous parking fee, I considered this when making my bid. First time using priceline and was happy that I got the hilton. We traveled with 2 young toddlers so convenience, pool, and nonsmoking are our priorities. After reading a bad review that the front desk treated guest who booked thru priceline badly, I was worried. However, my husband checked in and all went smoothly. I did call after I booked the hotel to request for 2 double and a mini fridge. But, there was no fridge when we got to our rooms. It took 2 phone calls and the finally sent the fridge (around 9pm). Keep in mind, that this is suppose to be a 4 star hotel. When we stayed at the Hyatt, they sent the fridge as soon as we stepped in our rooms. The good thing is that all rooms are nonsmoking. We got double bed with city view. The beds were very comfortable with 6 fluffy pillows. Queen beds would be better since it is a 4 star hotel. The decor were trendy with steel lamps and wood armoire. The bathroom had granite countertop and double sink. It was kind of small in my opinion There is a small outdoor pool on the roof of the second floor terrace as well as a fitness room. The nice touch was a bowl of granny smith apples at the front desk and complimentary sunday newspaper. The location of the hotel was convenient since it is around the corner to 5th avenue in gaslamp quarater. There is a starbuck on the corner, ralphs supermarket and albertsons on market st. Try pinkberry yogurt just around the corner. The hotel is also a short drive (5min) to balboa park and 10 minutes to seaworld and coronado island and in and out burger. La jolla beach was less than 20 minutes away. We did hear the train at night and it did get annoying. But on saturday night, there was no train noise. So, if you are a light sleeper, beware. The really negative is that this hotel is valet parking only: $32 for over night with in/out privileges.The sign says $8 for valet so even if you don't park overnight there still a fee? When we arrived, the valet fellow asked us if we plan to park overnight and it would be charged to your room. It can really add up if you are paying the rack rate. You can park in public parking a block away for $20. But, since we had young kids and a rental car that is not insured, we did not want the hassle. In summary, I would not pay full rate for this 4 star unless I was traveling withou kids and my priority was gaslamp area. The valet only parking fee is pricey compared to other locations. There was no special turndown service or any speical amenities to justify the price. I have stayed at hyatt in tampa for less and they had better service, shuttle, and optional valet. But maybe its just san diego and because it is downtown. I understand that parking fees are the norm but $32 is outrageous. I mean you still have to tip each time they bring your car around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Option”
Reviews.Author: abcdef999
Reviews.Content: This is a newer hotel in a great location, near the convention center, PetCo Park, and the Gaslamp District. It is also easy to get around to other areas of the city. The hotel is not fancy but it is very nice and clean. Also has the best hotel breakfast I have ever had. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Sneered at for using Priceline”
Reviews.Author: LuvCruzan
Reviews.Content: First of all, the Hilton website is wrong. I was told by the obviously superior girl at the front desk that this hotel no longer has as Executive floor/lounge with complimentary breakfast. Never have I been so blatantly discriminated against for using Priceline to book a room as I was at this hotel. I have heard of hotel staff giving the snub nose to Priceline guests, but mostly in the NYC market (my brother being one of those said staff). Well, being a Hilton Gold Honors member got us zero respect or perks here. We were given the tiniest room in the old tower, the room had obviously been smoked in, and told that upgrades were not available to guests who book through a third party (regardless of Hilton Honors). In the end, Hilton has a right to do whatever they want, and I assume their preference would be that the â€œPriceline riff-raffâ€� just stays away. The next time I Priceline San Diego, I will just hope and pray that I do not get the Hilton Gaslamp again. If I do, at least I know what to expect. A nod to Hyatt Hotels, regardless of third party booking, their staff continues to treat all guests fair and equal, especially the San Diego location. Too bad our hotel rewards are for Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: Jonavin
Reviews.Content: Great service. Everybody was friendly and helpful. Great location. Easy walking distance to lots of bars and restaurants, and the train is right beside the hotel. From our hotel room we were also able to get a nice view of the fireworks. Rooms were excellent. The only bad point is that only valet parking is available, no self-park option.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing... Simply Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: jreelfs
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying the valet team is wonderful. Never have I had a valet team so knowledgeable about the area and so nice and friendly at the same time. I stayed for 3 nights and everything was perfect. I had requested a corner room after hearing the corner rooms were a little more spacious (definitely worth requesting) and it was wonderful. The room I was given had two windows so it seemed as if it was even larger than it was, there was a large sized work desk with a very comfortable work chair. There was even a sofa in the room. Unfortunately I was placed on the back side of the hotel right by the train and trolley tracks, I never heard the trolley but the first two nights I was woken up at 4am to a loud train horn. But the bed was so comfortable I was able to fall asleep almost immediately afterwards. Some of the other nice amenities I enjoyed was the weekday newspaper being delivered directly to my room without me having to go downstairs to get a copy. The bathroom was a bit on the tiny side but more than adequate. The bath amenities were excellent. The bed was so comfortable I did not want to wake up in the morning.. The only issue I really had was the fact that even though the valet's were extremely nice and very knowledgeable the price for valet parking was outrageous at $32 a night with no self-parking offered. You could park on the street if you were lucky enough to find an empty spot, however you would have to feed the meter every two hours. The location is excellent so you shouldn't need to rent a car to get around. Plenty of taxis and other restaurants within walking distance. However if you must bring your own car don't fear the parking charge, the valet's make up for that with their promptness. Their manager Sam i believe was extremely friendly and gave me directions to many great places to dine. Great job Hilton. I will be returning again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Surprise Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ExactingTraveller
Reviews.Content: After a problem with my reservations at Hotel Solamar, the hotel moved me and my family to the Hilton Gaslamp to accommodate our needs. What a surprise. I'm not a big fan of Hilton Hotels. Not only is it a beautiful and relatively small hotel but it is located in an ideal area close but away from the noise of the Gaslamp District. Will stay here again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Gaslamp has THE best concierge in town!”
Reviews.Author: Dublinlass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from 10 days on the west coast. It was our good fortune to start our tour by staying in the Hilton in the gaslamp district. Well little did we know that we were about to meet the best concierge we have ever met on our extensive travels around the world. Mike Denton was at all times up to date on EVERYTHING we asked from hotels to restaurants to attractions all the way up the coast to LA! This man booked rooms( all came with upgrades because of his networking skills), restaurants ( best tables in the house) ,advised what beaches to go to,what attractions to see in the city, where to have the best ice-cream in Coronado! there was no end to his advice. The crowning glory was when we arrived back in San Diego and checked into our accommodation ( not the Hilton having decided before we arrived to have a change) and were told on arrival that he had telephoned to make sure our booking was good and the dinner reservation he had made for the last evening was all in order! A gem! Thank you Mike you made our trip wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrotterGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently used Hilton Points for a very nice weekend here, after spending the week at another nearby hotel for a business conference. Overall, our stay was quite good. The hotel is located right on the edge of the Gaslamp Quarter, near numerous restaurants, shopping, and the baseball stadium. Everything you need is within walking distance, so no need for a rental car or taxis, once you arrive. Despite being in an active area, we found our room to be quiet. Some previous reviewers have mentioned noise from the nearby train tracks, but we didn't have a problem - the light-rail trolley isn't noisy at all, and the Amtrak train only came by once a day during the daytime. The hotel has a stylish, modern, boutique feel. The breakfast buffet was excellent. The restaurant doubles as a sophisticated little bar in the evening (nothing loud or crazy). Our room was well maintained and very comfortable. The lighting was a bit quirky, with VERY tall bedside lamps that were difficult to turn off or on while lying in bed. The bathroom light operated by a motion sensor, so it came on as soon as I entered, even in the middle of the night, before I could close the door (so the light shone out into the bedroom itself, waking my wife). The pool was a bit small, but generally adequate. Overall, I highly recommend the Hilton Gaslamp. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: mattman206
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while attending a conference and found our stay very enjoyable. My plane arrived early and it was no problem to check in a couple hours early. The person at the desk was extremely helpful and very friendly. The room was spotless and had a modern-looking decor theme. One night I needed to grab a quick bite to eat and visited the New Leaf restaurant in the lobby. The hamburger that I got was delicious and the staff was very friendly and chatty. One (very minor) quirk with our stay is that the light in the bathroom has a motion sensor so you have to wait 10 minutes for it to shut off automatically before going to sleep. The hotel has free _wired_ internet to every room, which is nice. Unfortunately there is only 1 plug/cord on the desk, so with 2 laptops in the room we had to alternate. There is no wireless access.

Reviews.Title: “4 star Hilton/Great location”
Reviews.Author: VegasHotel80
Reviews.Content: I just recently stayed at the Hilton Gaslamp. The hotel was very nice and worthy of its 4 star status. I had arrived at about 945 am and was able to check in to my room right away. The front desk agent was very polite and gave me a room on the 3rd floor, king bed as requested. The entire property is non-smoking which was great. My room was pretty spacious and had a small balcony that overlooked the pool and the convention center/trolley tracks. I sat out there both nights watching the people and taking in the view/breeze. The noise from the trains/trolley was never bothersome. The room also had a sofa and good size bathroom. They also have a nice pool area on the second floor and a small gym. The location cannot be beat. The Gaslamp trolley station is right next to the hotel. I took it several times to get around. There are a bunch of nice restaurants in the area as well. The baseball stadium is about a 3-5 min walk and itâ€™s about a 10 min walk to get to Horton Plaza . The entire neighborhood was very clean. Everyone was out exercising or walking their dogs. There is really not a need to rent a car since everything is within walking distance or near the trolley. I took the bus from the airport to downtown, then took the trolley a few stops to the hotel, very easy and cheap. I would highly recommend the Hilton to anyone coming to San Diego . I got a great deal using priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: KiwiInPimlico
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend for a girlie weekend and was quite impressed with the hotel and certainly the service - particularly as the quality of Hilton hotels can vary widely. We shared a room with 2 double-beds and my only gripe is that the bathroom was a bit small. The rooms themselves are well laid-out and a good size - despite being located beside tram tracks, and opposite the Hard Rock hotel, they were really quiet! The hotel is in a great location, and we found the staff and overall customer service excellent. The Gaslamp area is in close walking distance, and we felt very safe wandering around. I would definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great with some big frustrations”
Reviews.Author: DocJ2005
Reviews.Content: I had a relatively decent experience at this particular Hilton. I booked several months in advance for a King Terrace Loft Suite in the 5th avenue section, yet when I arrived, the hotel staff placed me in a downgraded King deluxe guest room (essentially with a bed, a TV, a bathroom, and a little chair in the corner). I called the front desk to figure out what happened, and the young lady stated that I was, in fact, staying in a King suite. I had to explain to her that this room was indeed NOT a suite and not the King Terrace Loft Suite that I specifically booked and paid for. Well, this was 11pm at this time, and of course, there was no King Terrace Loft Suite available in the hotel. However, the staff did anticipate that some guests would check out and "free up" one of those rooms tomorrow - that my "chances were very good" that I'd get transferred the following day. I'm a reasonable guy, but I had a tired wife an 18 month-old child. We slept in this small room and were transferred to the suite that we actually booked the following day. Overall, it seemed like the staff was doing this begrudgingly, and that I was getting some special favor despite me showing them a printout of my reservation stating what I had booked. There was a very helpful young lady the following day at the desk who apologized for the mishap and gave us a voucher for a free breakfast at the New Leaf (delicious). The King Terrace Loft Suite was a beautiful, spacious room with contemporary colors and a splendid bed. The view was not great - it overlooked the Hard Rock Hotel across the street that was being built & had pretty noise construction.. not the fault of the Hilton. The bathroom was gorgeous with plentiful, high quality toiletries, a jacuzzi tub, and a large glass shower. However, the next day, my laptop's CPU had this weird meltdown - frying the internal circuitry while it was plugged into the hotel's outlet. I have no idea if this was related to the outlets there, but Apple's repair department said they'd only seen this particular crash about 2-3 times before. I would've chalked this up as a coincidence without laying any blame on the Hilton.. but on the same day, my plug-in clock/ambient noise maker froze and would not turn back on - never happened before or since. A few hours later, we smelled a terrible burning coming from the bathroom, only to find one of the wall lamps smoking. The hotel staff sent up a repairman a few hours later to take care of it. I really didn't think the room was safe from an electrical standpoint.. imagine that? Location is very centrally located - parking deck right down the sidewalk which was inexpensive and next to Petco Park. There is no need to pay the exorbitant valet fees, which are approaching $40/night. The gorgeous convention center is literally 1 block away.. overall, this is a pretty nice hotel in a fabulous city. The stay, however, could've been better - but for the most part, it was enjoyable. My advice to hotel management would be to explain to the front desk workers about the definition of a suite, and to never change a guest's previously booked room unless it's an upgrade. These types of things are enough to make me think twice in my future trips to San Diego about whether to spend them at this particular Hilton. I'm plus/minus on the experience - would've been wonderful except for a number of mild to moderate annoyances.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: BionicBanjo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a weeks holiday with my partner. Really close to the shops etc. Room service was great and the upstairs open air bar was fun. Room was clean and tidy. Front Desk helpful as our luggage was lost. Recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not a typical Hilton, in a good way”
Reviews.Author: airin11
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm used to HIltons in less urban areas, but this HIlton wasn't cookie-cutter, boring. It was very chic and trendy. I liked it The location was great for us. We were there for a convention. And our convention happened to be in the end of the center right across the street from the hotel. The anchor hotel for the convention was about twice as far. So that worked out in our favor. Its also right at the start of blocks upon blocks of restaurants, shops, bars, etc. We couldn't have asked for a better location. The room was good. We stayed on the side overlooking the lofts. We looked down onto a cement courtyard. Not very interesting. Noise was never a problem for us, and we stayed through the weekend. We were also in the room right next to the elevator shaft, and we never heard that either. My only complaint is the shower. The first couple of days the drain was slow, but the water did go down. Then one day, the drain wasn't working, or it was very slow. I played with plug in the shower drain, but didn't really want to touch it because it was rusty around the edges. By the end of my shower, I was standing in 2 inches of water. The next day, the drain was back to what it had been. Never enough to complain, but annoying. And with how nice the rest of the hotel and room were, I wasn't impressed with the shower. Like I said, it was rusty around the drain, and the metal disk between the shower head and shower wall had fallen off so that it was hanging around the neck of the shower head. And it seems like a lot of hotel bathrooms, there wasn't a fan in there. So we dealt with steamy mirrors every morning. And the lighting wasn't great. Hard to put make up on in the morning. Overall, nice hotel. Maybe a few annoyances, but never enough to complain. I guess we didn't spend enough time in the hotel for it to be too bothersome.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Hilton”
Reviews.Author: bostongirl19
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a typical Hilton property, this is it. The staff was helpful and pleasant (room service was extremely quick), rooms were comfortable and clean, and the location was perfect if you are going to the convention center. It is also right outside the gaslamp district, which is great when looking for a place to eat after a long day. All in all, no problems dealing with anything at the hotel, but it is not the type of hotel that is exactly going to wow you, either. I was staying on a business trip, and for that, it was perfect. A note on the trains/trolleys however. Yes, you are going to hear them. I dont really know if there is a way around hearing them if your staying anywhere near the tracks. That being said, I got used to them after the second night. Also, ask to be located on the 12th floor (which is the top floor), as you will have a balcony. Not needed per se, however, I really enjoyed being able to wake up in the morning and have coffee on my balcony!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton was a gas gas gas!”
Reviews.Author: karma
Reviews.Content: nice contemporary look- great artwork all over the hotel. Gym is fresh and new- free weights, new machines, roomy. Right across the street is the convention center and there are a great set of stadium steps people are doing their workouts on. as well as the waterfront parks on the otherside. Bedrooms were decent sized , the usual comfy hilton beds, well equipped, we liked the little touches like milano cookies at the turndown service- Internet service was great and free, wired in the room and wireless in the lounge/lobby area. careful if you are a light sleeper- the hotel is built right on the train tracks and the trolley/train blows its horn at exactly 4am so depending on the side of the hotel you are staying.... Also- friday and saturday gets crazy at the hard rock hotel next door- avoid that side as well on the weekend. restaurant/ bar area is small but comfortable- the breakfast buffett was amazing (frsh squeezed orange juice) but overpriced at $19- Very helpful and friendly staff in the restaurant and throughout. We enjoyed people watching from our breakfast table every morningwith all the walkers, joggers and dog walkers right outside on the bike path in front of the hotel. The location was wonderful with access to the trolley which we used to go everywhere including seaworld and the beaches- so easy we cancelled our car rental! The Gaslamp district is right out the door and we had a ball going to restaurants, movies etc every night. The consierge was very professional and you can buy tickets to the zoo, seaworld etc. from him at a slight discount and charged to the room. - All and All our family had a wonderful stay and would come back again... Good restaurants we ate at RA- great sushi bar in a lively settig - young crowd, al aqua 2, florence style italian. Yardhouse- 200 beers on tap- decent food, Gaslamp tavern- decent pub stle lunch, Freds Mexican- decent- family friendly- the food court at Horton Plaza is an amazing selection- with some healthy options- we had the mongolian grill- pick your own meats and veggies and they wok it up with no oil. good lunch Movie theatre in the horton plaza had better selection, but the one on 5th is a cool old classic place and comfy seats... gotta go through the new hard rock and the bar on the fourth floor- california outdoor living at its best- firepits, city view, cabanas..

Reviews.Title: “Not so Hot”
Reviews.Author: PQBrown
Reviews.Content: After some careful searching, we decided to book our hotel through Hotwire, knowing there was a possibility of staying at the Hilton. What a mistake! We were ready to be gouged for parking ($32/day plus the obligatory tips). We were NOT ready for an indifferent (bordering on "rude") staff; notably the front desk personnel. Arriving in the mid-afternoon, there was no crowded counter. Just a young woman who either did not like her job or her customers (who largely contribute to her salary ... right?). The room was tiny. Well decorated. Tiny. An alley view. Tiny. Not well ventilated. Tiny. Loud. Did I mention it was small? The bathroom had not been cleaned well (was the family giving Paris an internship?). The noise between the rooms were excessive. On one of our four days our room was not cleaned (did Paris walk out?). Compared to everything else, checking out was a treat: they simply left us alone with our final bill that included the tab for parking and the over priced movies. We will definately be avoiding any and all Hiltons in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Good Hotel-Perfect for SD Covention Center Location”
Reviews.Author: Iamvonda
Reviews.Content: I had a trade show to attend at the San Diego Convention Center. This was my first time there. I wanted a hotel close to the Center so I wouldn't have to worry about parking. This hotel is as close as you are going to get. The location to the Center is ideal. You are literally on one side of the trolley tracks and the Convention Center is on the other side. GREAT location if your going to the Convention Center! The hotel itself was very nice. The interior was very up to date. It had a warm rich feel to it. Our room was decorated in warm dark tones. Everything was in good condition. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. I was only disappointed in two things. There was no continental breakfast. A danish and some free coffee would have been nice. The parking costs $30.00 per day. To me that is extremely high; but the valets were very friendly and helpful. There was NO street parking available so I didn't have any choice except to pay the high parking fee. I think the nearest parking lot was over a block away. Overall the Hilton was a great choice for us. I would also recommend Fred's cantina which was about 3 blocks from the hotel. Not a far walk at all. They had great lobster tacos and chicken sandwiches. And the staff were very friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place - Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Programmer_eng
Reviews.Content: Probably the worst thing was the freight trains at 2 AM. However, my stay was enjoyable. One thing I wish they had was a washer and dryer. The cost of dry cleaning was way too $$$$$.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: ramblingranny
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the week between Christmas and New Year. The hotel is decorated in a modern minimalist style. The beds have soft bedding,and the room was spacious although the bathroom was slightly small. There was free internet access. We ate the breakfast buffet and it was quite adequate. Try the local restaurants in the Gaslamp area. This hotel is located across the street from the convention center and Petco Park. The Gaslamp district is around the corner. The Midway carrier museum is about 3/4 mile away. The Trolley runs next to the hotel and goes to two big shopping centers. This is an extremely convenient location. The two downsides are 1) a BNSF train chugs by at about 4AM and hoots it's horn and wakes the entire neighborhood! 2) The only parking is valet parking and it's $30 a day, although the valets were efficient and fast. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Please redo lobby”
Reviews.Author: Elosofamoso
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many Hiltons in the US and in Europe, and this one is fine, but it still has a few annoying flaws that should have been corrected long ago. My wife and I stayed here for four nights from Thursday to Monday. If you don't care about the lobby, then you can skip most of what I will say. The lobby is one of the most annoying that I have ever experienced, especially for breakfast. First, the seating area used breakfast has tables with regular chairs combined with a sofa that will sink to an uncomfortably low level once you sit on it. That means the person on the regular chair will be sitting at normal height relative to the table, but the one on the sofa will be eating their breakfast seemingly under the table. Not the best situation if you value eye contact with your conversation partner. This annoys both the customer and the waiter, who then is asked to rearrange tables and chairs to avoid the sofa altogether. That means chairs will now be repositioned between other tables. This is fine when no one else is around you, but looks ridiculous when the area is full. The perfectly good eating area does not open until later because, according to our waiter, it is assigned to a waiter who comes in later. So why not just switch waiter assignments so that the customer comes first? And then there is the chef, who was not present to cook our omelette when breakfast opened. Question: Why not have the breakfast chef come in when you say you are ready for breakfast? And do you want a TV where you can see the whole screen? No luck here. The TV in the lobby had a large black strip. This is the HIlton, for Conrad's sake--- can we not even get a TV with a full screen visible? Now that I got those pet peeves out of the way, I will say that they are outweighed by the positive features of the hotel. It's location is great, and the rooms are nice. I will stay here again, especially if they fix the problems with breakfast and the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Good location- noisy room.”
Reviews.Author: kmc1974
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotal using Hilton Honors points, so I did not pay the fairly high-price the room would have gone for, which probably means I am giving them a bit of slack! First off- great location- lots of restaurants and bars. The room was nice, a King Deluxe in the Lofts area of the hotel. Big enough but fairly umnremarkable. Boring bathroom. nothing fancy. The first night we were there was a Thursday night, and my husaband had just arrived in CA from the East Coast to meet me after I had been on business in San Fran, and he feel asleep pretty early and easily. However I was in CA for almost a week at this point and closer to West Coast time, so I stayed up a bit and noticed a very annoying, pounding bass sound emanating through our room. My husband slept through it, so I thought maybe it wasn't as bad as I thought. I defintley should have asked the next morning to be moved. Our room looked out over the outside patio area of the Hard Rock Hotel bar, and that was the culprit. The noise got worse each noght and went on later each night. We never complained and asked to be moved, which we should have done, so that was our fault. Between the time-difference, and being exhausted from the day's activities and having imbibed several (rough estimate) cocktails we did sleep, but be careful when you check in.
